title: Charging Airbnb guests a one-time fee | Help Center
short_description: How to request a one-time fee from guests who booked through Airbnb.
article: In some situations, you may want to charge an upcoming guest an additional, one-time fee after their reservation is confirmed. This feature is only available for Airbnb reservations. Fairly can help process these charges directly through Airbnb so they are secure and documented. Looking for guest damage reimbursement instructions? Damage Protection support article How it worksBefore initiating the fee, talk to the guest and confirm they agree to pay the additional fee. Here’s an example of what these messages might say:1. Once the guest as agreed to pay, contact Fairly Support to assist with the request: Email support@fairly.com with: 1. Guest’s full name - Booking dates - Your home’s address - A note for the guest describing what the fee is for 2. Note: We can only process charges for future, booked reservations. 2. Fairly submits the request to Airbnb: Our team will send the charge request to the guest through Airbnb’s platform. 3. Guest approval window: The guest has 72 hours to accept the charge from Airbnb. 4. Confirmation: We’ll follow up with you once the guest has accepted. 5. Payout: The fee will be paid out after the guest checks out, and will be separate than your rent payout. 1. The payment will appear as a separate “Damages reimbursement” payout.Examples of when to use this- Guest is having an approved event at your home and has agreed to an event fee. - Guest is bringing approved additional pets for an extra fee.When not to use this- Guest wants to change their reservation dates or add pets. In this case, refer to these instructions: Change requests from guests - Guest caused damage in the home. In this case, refer to these instructions: Damage Protection Insurance
claude_summary: Explains how hosts can charge Airbnb guests additional one-time fees after reservation confirmation through Fairly Support, including process steps and appropriate use cases.
